alert.note: Alert for Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 11:19AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cherry County through 1100 AM MDT... At 1018 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Merriman, or 17 miles southeast of Martin. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Merriman and Eli. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 135 and 148. Highway 61 between mile markers 225 and 231. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
